# toCoordinateRegion()

**Instance Method**

Returns the region that corresponds to a map rectangle.

## Declaration

```swift
toCoordinateRegion(): CoordinateRegion;
```

## Return Value

A [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/CoordinateRegion] object that corresponds to a map rectangle.

## Discussion

It’s often easier to work with a map rectangle than a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/CoordinateRegion].

The following example demonstrates how to convert a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/MapRect] instance to a [doc://com.apple.mapkitjs/documentation/MapKitJS/CoordinateRegion] and back again:

```javascript
const mapRect = new mapkit.MapRect(0.1, 0.2, 0.3, 0.4);

// Return a coordinate region with center (33.841220320476786, -90) and span (106.57400641480324, 108).
const coordinateRegion = mapRect.toCoordinateRegion();

// Return the same map rectangle as mapRect, plus or minus any floating point inaccuracies.
const newMapRect = coordinateRegion.toMapRect();
```

## Working with map rectangles

- **copy()**: Returns a copy of a map rectangle.
- **equals(anotherRect)**: Compares whether two map rectangles are equal.
- **scale(scaleFactor, scaleCenter)**: Returns a scaled map rectangle for a map location.
